lexUnit.name: crazy.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: insane or unbalanced, especially as manifested in wild or aggressive behaviour.

sentence.text: As Lesley Bell , director of Joint Initiative for Community Care , says : ` It is absolutely crazy that anyone can set up a home care agency with no form of regulation whatsoever .
“ It 's crazy that he even refused to use my blend when he must have known it was working well … ”
It seemed crazy that she could n't ask outright -- claim the relationship which was almost certainly hers .
But it 's crazy to want to preserve her people as they are now -- poor , exploited , without schools or health care . "
` It 's crazy to think you must have an ` ideal " skinny shape .
It 's crazy to risk crashing during tests . "
I wanted to meet Marius Durance -- I 've always especially admired his work and it seemed crazy to be so close and not come face to face with him .
All of her deepest , oldest instincts told her it was crazy to put her faith in any man .
It would be crazy to leave it empty , and I do n't think I could bring myself to sell my old family home .
` It is absolutely crazy to have 9,000 tonnes of limestone a week going by road when the Government is offering grants to try to ensure that freight is carried by rail .
` It would be crazy to reject a treaty which is positively beneficial -- and one the rejection of which would be so damaging . "
From any of these positions I would be crazy to make him play with the left knee inflamed the way it is . "
A MAN has to be either rich or crazy to make films in Latin America these days .
It might seem a little crazy to move house rather than decorate the kitchen , and then finish up taking on an almost derelict house instead .
` They would realise that foreign players think we 're crazy to be playing more matches rather than fewer when our game is faster and more competitive than the rest .
You 'd be crazy to sell today .
Oh , Billie , I must have been crazy to let you come with me .
For a long time she lay awake , staring into the darkness and telling herself that she had been absolutely crazy to let this happen .
` I 'm crazy , and when I come to my senses I 'll know that I 'm crazy to admit it to anyone .
Consultant anaesthetist Dr Mike Jordan , who has been on the planning team for nine years , adds : ` It would be crazy for it not to be used .

Darlington MP Michael Fallon said it was crazy for the brochure to encourage people to stay so far from the town .
He remembered Katherine 's admonition about Berlin being like a cage , and how animals often go crazy in captivity .
PS You 're definitely crazy for giving everyone TWO Megatapes .
Tock was striking at the cogs at the top of the pole , banging the machinery and shouting at it like a crazy old man .

What a crazy idea , picnicking up a mountain at this time of year .

You know it 's crazy .
